snippet: Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, who is now a member of Parliament, told corporate executives in Thailand, “I would not like you to be overoptimistic.”
abstract: Myanmar opposition leader Daw Aung San Suu Kyi warns potential foreign investors of the problems facing her country, including an educational system that is in shambles and youth unemployment; fears that a flood of investments could harm Myanmar by increasing corruption and inequality.

byline.contributor: Steven Lee Myers contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, who is now a member of Parliament, told corporate executives in Thailand, “I would not like you to be overoptimistic.”

headline.main: Democracy Leader Cautions Investors Against ‘Reckless Optimism’ in Myanmar
headline.print_headline: Democracy Leader Cautions Investors Against ‘Reckless Optimism’ in Myanmar
